caption.title: What is known about the subject?

list-item.p: The COVID-19 pandemic has changed the lives of families and children almost everywhere in the world.
Children are susceptible to COVID-19 although clinically they are present with milder symptoms compared with the elderly, and the general population.

Given the lack of effective treatment, measures taken by governments in several countries in order implement social distances included school closure, and even in some cases children were confined to the home.
These measures, mainly following the precautionary principle, were based on the experiences of previous epidemics (ie, influenza) where children were the main transmitters.
